categories.summary:
# Discord Chat Analysis

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around ElizaOS development, with discussions about its architecture, plugins, and technical implementation details. Key technical topics include:

- Migration from v1 to v2 architecture, where "clients" have been replaced with "plugins + services"
- Questions about implementing recurring tasks in ElizaOS using task workers
- Discussion about pinning GitHub dependencies in project configuration
- Vector database usage, with pg-vector mentioned as a solution
- API key configuration for services like DeepSeekAI
- Compatibility concerns between pre-1.0.0 plugins and v1.0.0
- A developer (standard) returning to ElizaOS development and trying to understand the new v2 architecture
- Issues with Anthropic API integration showing "invalid x-api-key" errors despite proper configuration
- A collection of MCP servers was shared (300+ servers)
- Security concerns about potential scam links were raised and addressed

The conversation shows active community engagement around technical implementation details and architecture changes in ElizaOS.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What method to start it works for you? (asked by Tiki) A: Unanswered
Q: Will auto have a whitelist mechanism or be completely fair launch? (asked by Yuto) A: Unanswered
Q: Anyone know how to pin a version of the github dependency? (asked by DefiniteOptimist) A: Unanswered
Q: What vector databases are peeps using these days? Is Pinecone a standard? (asked by Hidden Forces) A: pg-vector for me! (answered by DefiniteOptimist)
Q: How to use the DeepSeekAI for V2? There is no place to input the ApiKey. (asked by loyce.eth) A: DEEPSEEK_API_KEY (answered by Sashimikun)
Q: Are pre-1.0.0 plugins compatible with v1.0.0? (asked by Tiki) A: Depends on how complex it is. If simple enough, it will be, otherwise you have to make changes. (answered by Ritvik S)
Q: Where do I run the execute function for recurring tasks? (asked by Ritvik S) A: Unanswered
Q: What's the difference between elizaos/eliza and elizaos/core? (asked by standard) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Veight | Helpee: ElizaBAOðŸŒŸ | Context: Warning about scam links being shared | Resolution: ElizaBAO moved crypto to another wallet for safety
Helper: Sashimikun | Helpee: loyce.eth | Context: How to use DeepSeekAI in V2 | Resolution: Advised to use DEEPSEEK_API_KEY environment variable
Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: loyce.eth | Context: DEEPSEEK_API_KEY not found in ElizaOS V2 | Resolution: Suggested using it from local-ai plugin as support may not be added yet
Helper: Ritvik S | Helpee: Tiki | Context: Compatibility of pre-1.0.0 plugins with v1.0.0 | Resolution: Explained partial compatibility with needed changes
Helper: mekpans | Helpee: standard | Context: Understanding new architecture | Resolution: Explained clients were replaced by plugins + services

## 4. Action Items
Type: Technical | Description: Implement support for DeepSeekAI in ElizaOS V2 | Mentioned By: loyce.eth
Type: Technical | Description: Fix issue with Anthropic API integration showing "invalid x-api-key" errors | Mentioned By: mekpans
Type: Technical | Description: Implement recurring tasks functionality with clear documentation | Mentioned By: Ritvik S
Type: Documentation | Description: Document the architecture change from clients to plugins+services in v2 | Mentioned By: standard
Type: Documentation | Description: Create documentation on how to pin GitHub dependency versions | Mentioned By: DefiniteOptimist
Type: Feature | Description: Add support for Bailian AI plugins | Mentioned By: lay.qin
Type: Documentation | Description: Provide examples of what replaced auto-client in the new architecture | Mentioned By: standard

# Discord Chat Analysis for ðŸ¤–ï½œagent-dev-school

## 1. Summary
The chat segment covers discussions about Eliza's documentation accuracy and version differences between v1 and v2. A user (mindxploit) expressed confusion about locating agents created via CLI in the v2dev version, noting that they don't appear in the codebase. G2 suggested agents might be stored in `/packages/the-org`, but mindxploit clarified this only contains premade agents, not newly created ones. The user questioned where new agents should be created and how CLI-created agents are stored if not in the visible codebase. Additionally, there was a brief exchange about the scheduling of agent dev school sessions, with shaw mentioning they're paused for 1-2 weeks until v2 and auto.fun are released. Nisita shared a public Google Calendar link for tracking all events after Shiva M requested calendar integration.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Which part of the docs aren't accurate? (asked by jin) A: Unanswered
Q: Where are the actual agents stored in the v2dev version? (asked by mindxploit) A: I think the agents get stored in `/packages/the-org`. (answered by G2)
Q: Where should new agents be created? (asked by mindxploit) A: Unanswered
Q: How is it possible that CLI-created agents aren't found in the code? (asked by mindxploit) A: Unanswered
Q: Can we expect an agent dev school tomorrow? (asked by Jacob Homanics) A: We paused until v2 and auto.fun are out the door so I can focus on it, 1-2 weeks, sorry ðŸ˜¦ (answered by shaw)
Q: Could we have an event created for the calendar? (asked by Shiva M) A: Here's a Public calendar that reflects all events [link provided] (answered by Nisita)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: G2 | Helpee: mindxploit | Context: Confusion about where agents are stored in v2dev | Resolution: Partial - suggested `/packages/the-org` but was clarified this only contains premade agents
Helper: Nisita | Helpee: Shiva M | Context: Request for calendar event for agent dev school | Resolution: Successful - provided a public Google Calendar link with all events

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Update documentation to accurately reflect v2 implementation | Description: Current docs don't fully cover v2 functionality differences | Mentioned By: mindxploit
Documentation: Clarify where newly created agents are stored in v2dev | Description: Users can't locate agents created via CLI | Mentioned By: mindxploit
Documentation: Document the process for creating new agents in v2 | Description: Need clear instructions on agent creation workflow | Mentioned By: mindxploit
Feature: Resume agent dev school sessions | Description: Currently paused until v2 and auto.fun release | Mentioned By: shaw

# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ“¥ï½œpull-requests

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around plugin management and pull request reviews for ElizaOS. Odilitime actively helped with clarifying questions about npm versioning and descriptions for plugins, though there seemed to be some communication challenges. Several pull requests were discussed and merged, including fixes for the BNB plugin and Twitter client. Hishboy mentioned completing and testing a Farcaster plugin that was ready for review. There was also a request to review a PR that would enable custom embedding model names and dimensions for the OpenAI plugin. The conversation demonstrates the collaborative nature of the ElizaOS ecosystem, with community members helping each other with plugin development, bug fixes, and feature enhancements.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How to change the name and version on npm? (asked by AIFlow.ML @ ElizaOS) A: There is no official way to set descriptions, and there is no versioning as far as known. (answered by Odilitime)
Q: How is the farcaster plugin coming along? (asked by mekpans) A: It's ready for review. "Spent all day testing it. Should be good" (answered by hishboy)
Q: What is everyone else using for farcaster? (asked by mekpans) A: Odilitime shared a GitHub link: https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/client-farcaster

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: AIFlow.ML @ ElizaOS | Context: Questions about npm versioning and descriptions for plugins | Resolution: Clarified that there's no official versioning and descriptions are hardcoded in some directories
Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: AIFlow.ML @ ElizaOS | Context: Request to merge PR for BNB plugin | Resolution: Successfully merged PR #2
Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: hishboy | Context: Request to review PR for custom embedding model parameters in OpenAI plugin | Resolution: Successfully merged the PR

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Merge PR for BNB plugin to fix bugs and building errors | Mentioned By: AIFlow.ML @ ElizaOS
Technical: Merge PR for Twitter client | Mentioned By: AIFlow.ML @ ElizaOS
Technical: Review PR for custom embedding model name and dimensions in OpenAI plugin | Mentioned By: hishboy
Technical: Release new version of plugin-bnb in the registry | Mentioned By: AIFlow.ML @ ElizaOS
Feature: Support for custom embedding model name and dimensions in OpenAI plugin | Mentioned By: hishboy
